alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 27 at 5:49PM EDT until May 27 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN JOHNSTON AND SOUTHERN WAKE COUNTIES... At 549 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over Holly Springs. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring with reports of flooded roads in Holly Springs and Fuquay-Varina. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Raleigh, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Clayton, Zebulon, Apex, Holly Springs, Knightdale, Wendell, Lake Benson, Lake Wheeler, New Hill, Harris Lake Boat Launch and Shearon Harris Reservoir. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
